page.title: 19A SMALLHOLDING
page.content: The following is a description of a fairly typical holding although theY are changing at the moment since the L.S.A. was disbanded. Lettuce is grown in the autumn and winter, cropping all the glasshouses twice. There are 1 1/4 acres of glasshouses. About 100,000 lettuce are cut each crop. In spring and summer 60,000 heads of celery are grown for cutting in May and June and 80,000 are grown outdoors for cutting in July. In addition 30 tons of tomatoes are grown.The seeds are sown in December and the plants put in the glasshouse in February. Tomatoes are picked between May and September. The work is done by husband and wife with casual help at peak times.
